intro: Chusua brevicalcarata, commonly known as the short-spined chusua, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Chusua brevicalcarata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its visual interest.
